info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ADAMS... NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHWESTERN PERRY AND WESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Shippensburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shippensburg, Newville, Aspers, Walnut Bottom, Big Spring State Park, Doylesburg, Pine Grove Furnace, Roxbury, Bendersville, Orrstown, Idaville, Gardners, New Germantown and Shippensburg University. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Pennsylvania.
